D531210-d-05-29-10-SLWC.Narrative: JOB 301 COMPLETED BUILDING THERE TRAIN IN TRACK 6502 IN NORTH YARD, THEY NEEDED TO SHOVE THE TRAIN OUT THE EAST END OF THE YARD TO COMPLETE OTHER SWITCHING IN THE YARD BEFORE DEPARTING. CONDUCTOR, PERHIS STATEMENT HAD ALREADY LINED THE SWITCHES FOR THIS MOMEVENT EARLIER. ENGINEER ASKED TO VERIFY THAT ALL SWITCHES WERE LINED BEFORE THEMADE THE MOVEMENT. CONDUCTOR MADE COMMENT THAT "BE MY LUCK" ANDWENT TO DOUBLE CHECK THE SWITCHES AND WATCH THE SHOVE. CONDUCTOR CALLED THE ENGINEER AND VERIFIED THAT HE WAS LINE UP FOR THEIR MOVE. AFTER SHOVING THE TRAIN TO CLEAR THE WEST LEAD THEY STARTED SWITCH ON OTHER SWITHCES BEFORE DEPARTING. ONCE THE SWITCHING WAS DONE THEY GOT BACK ON THE TRAIN IN TRACK 6502 AND STARTED TO PULL AHEAD ABOUT 40 CARS TO SET OUT SOME UP CARS. ENGINEER ASKED THE CONDUCTORTO GO BACK AND MAKE THE CUT SO THEY WOULD NOT HAVE TO PULL THE ENTIRE TRAIN UP TO DO THE MOVE. THEYSTOPPED AFTER MOVING ABOUT 5-7 CARS PER BOTH CREW MEMBERS STATEMENTS. AT ABOUT 06:10, GENERAL MANAGER ARRIVED AT NORTH YARD AND WHILE GOING OVER HIGH STREET CROSSING NOTICED THE CARS ON THE EAST ENDOF THE YARD NOT LOOKING RIGHT. UPON INVESTIGATING FOUND 7 CARS DERAILED. FURTHER INVESTIGATING FOUND6502 SWITCH LINED FOR THE LEAD HAD BEEN RUN THROUGH THEN THE TRAIN PULLED BACK WEST CAUSING THE 7 CAR DERALMENT. I STOPPED THE CREW AND STARTED INVESTIGATION. UPON TAKING STATEMENTS WAS ABLE TO DETERMINE THE CARS HAD DERAILED AROUND 04:00. NO INJURIES TO THE CREW. CONDUCTOR WILL BE HELD RESPONSIBLE

05241001-d-05-24-10-CLC.Narrative: THE TRAIN CREW CALLED THE LOG STACKER YARD FOR PERMISSION TO TAKE THEIR CUT OF CARS THROUGH THEIR YARD TO NORPAC.  ONCE THEY RECEIVED PERMISSION, THEY PROCEEDED THROUGH THE STACKER CROSSING TO SHOVE THE CARS TO THE NORPAC PEROXIDE TRACKS.  THE BRAKEE AND CONDUCTOR WERE RIDING A LOADED PEROXIDE TANKCAR THAT WAS AT THE END OF OF THE CUT OF CARS IN ORDER TO PROTECT THE SHOVE.  ONCE THE REAR OF THE TRAIN WAS ON THE CROSSING, THE BRAKEE AND CONDUCTOR NOTICED THAT A LOADED LOG STACKER TRUCK (#988) WAS NOT SLOWING DOWN.  THE TWO EMPLOYEES JUMPED FROM THE END OF THE TANK CAR.  THE LOADED STACKER TRUCK HIT THE SIDE OF THE END TANK CAR, GATX 78546 WHICH WAS CARRYING HYDROGEN PEROXIDE 40 STRENGTH.  THE LOADED TANK CAR WAS PUNCTURED AND RIPPED OPEN BY THE STACKER TRUCK AND THE HYDROGEN PEROXIDE IN THE TANKER CAR SPILLED ONTO THE GROUND FOR A TOTAL OF 102.5 TONS.

672931-d-05-19-10-EJE.Narrative: WHILE PERFORMING NORMAL SWITCHING OPERATIONS, JOB YJTS30-19 SWITCHED ALAX 61545 INTO JM02 FROM THE SOUTH END AS A SINGLE CAR GOING INTO A CLEAR TRACK.  FIVE MORE LOADED CARS WERE PUT IN, ONE AT A TIME, THEN FOUR MORE LOADS PUT IN AS A BLOCK FOLLOWED.  A CAR INSPECTION LATER FOUND THE DAMAGED ON THESOUTH END OF ALAX 61545 DURING AN OUTBOUND INSPECTION AND THE CAR WAS BAD ORDERED AND TAKEN TO THE CAR SHOP.  THE LOCOMOTIVE WAS DOWNLOADED (INCLUDING VIDEO) AND SHOWS NO EVIDENCE OF ROUGH CAR HANDLING OR EXCESSIVE SPEED.  MAXIMUM SPEED NOTED DURING THE CUT ON WHICH THE CARS WERE SWITCHED WAS 3 MPH.CAR WAS SCRAPPED. INVESTIGATION INTO THIS INCIDENT FOUND THAT SIMILAR INCIDENCE INVOLVING MLLX CARSHAVE OCCURRED IN THE YARD.  A BULLETIN WAS ISSUED PROHIBITING KICKING OR ALLOWING FREE ROLLING CARSTO COUPLE DIRECTLY TO THIS SERIES OF CARS AND NO FURTHER INSTANCES HAVE OCCURRED.  IT WAS FOUND THAT THE ALAX 61545 WAS BUILT BY THE SAME MANUFACTURER AS MLLX CARS.  AAR RECORDS ARE BEING RESEARCHEDTO SEE IF THIS MAY BE A DESIGN DEFECT.

671346-d-05-21-10-EJE.Narrative: L51791-21 WAS IN THE PROCESS OF SWITCHING SEELER AND HAD SET 3 LOADED TANK CARS UP ON THE HILL.  THECREW THEN TIED ONTO 7 TANK CARS WHEN THE THREE CARS ROLLED DOWN THE HILL AND INTO THE SIDE OF THEIRTRAIN.  UTLX 200677 WAS DERAILED AND GATX 73770 DAMAGED WHEN IT IMPACTED THE TRAIN CAUSING DAMAGE TO CARS GATX 73785 AND TCIX 23002.  THE THREE CARS THAT HAD ROLLED DOWN THE HILL HAD ALL PISTONS RELEASED AND A HANDBRAKE ON UTLX 200677.  THE HILL THAT THE CARS WERE WERE LEFT ON HAS A 1.8% GRADE.  THE CREW WAS TESTED FOR CAUSE AND ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT THE CREW FAILED TO TIE ON SUFFICIENT HANDBRAKE TO HOLD THE CARS.  IT ALSO REVEALED THAT TWO OF THE THREE CARS (GATX 22870 & GATX 73770) PLACED ON THE HILL HAD LEAKS IN THE AIR BRAKE SYSTEM CAUSINGTHE BRAKES TO RELEASE EARLY. CAR GATX 73785 WAS SCRAPPED.

000075679-d-05-08-10-CSX.Narrative: Y19708 ONE MAN REMOTE CONTROL HUMP JOB COUPLED TO EAST END OF TRACK R04 IN PREPARATION TO HUMP CUT OF CARS, AFTER COUPLING, STRETCHING SLACK AND RELEASING HANDBRAKES, RCO WAS TRANSPORTED TO WEST END OF TRACK DRIVING ADJACENT TO R04 AND OBSERVING NO SEPARATION IN CUT OF CARS. BECAUSE TRACK WAS FULL AND PROXIMITY OF HEAD END TO EAST END OF TRACK, MOVEMENT WAS SHOVED WEST APPROXIMATELY TWO CAR LENGTHS AND STOPPED IN AN EFFORT TO OBSERVE SLACK RUN OUT AND CUT SOLID. MOVEMENT STOPPED BUT SLACK DID NOT RUN OUT. RCO AGAIN TRIED TO SHOVE WEST TO OBSERVE SLACK RUN OUT AND AGAIN MOVEMENT STOPPED BUT SLACK DID NOT RUN OUT. RCO THEN PULLED AHEAD IN AN ATTEMPT TO STRETCH SLACK FOULING EAST END OF TRACK R04 SIDESWIPING INBOUND Q60407 PULLING INTO TRACK R06. INVESTIGATION FOUND A SIX CAR SEPARATION IN MIDDLE OF TRACK WITH BUTTED KNUCKLES. PREVIOUSLY TRAIN X23103 PULLED INTO TRACK R04 TO WEST END, TRAINQ40905 SHOVED INTO R04 AGAINST THE REAR CAR OF X23103 BUT DID NOT COUPLE LEAVING TWO CUTS TOGETHERBUT NOT COUPLED.

0510RS020-d-05-26-10-UP.Narrative: THE YRV29R-26 CREW HAD HANDLE OF 71 CARS AND WERE IN THE PROCESS OF SHOVING BACK TO PICK UP AN ADDITIONAL 35 CARS.  THEIR CUT CONSISTED MAINLY OF EMPTY FLATS WITH 13 LOADED SCRAP CARS ON THE WEST END.WHILE PULLING, THE EMPTIES BUNCHED UP, WHEN THEY CAME TO A STOP THE LOADS RAN INTO AN EMPTY FLATCAR CAUSING IT TO DERAIL.  THE CREW WAS UNAWARE THEY HAD DERAILED AND STARTED THEIR SHOVE BACK INTO 29RAIL TO PICK UP THE ADDITIONAL CARS, 3 OF THE EMPTY FLATS JACKKNIFED COLLIDING WITH A CUT OF CARS ON TRACK 116 THAT WERE IN THE PROCESS OF BEING SHOVED INTO THE DEPARTURE YARD.  THREE CARS DERAILED ON TRACK 118 AND TWO CARS DERAILED ON TRACK 116.
